mods.abstract: RANAWAY From the plantation of the undersigned, in West Baton Rouge, about the 14th of AUGUST last, the negro man SAM, aged about 25 years, of black complexion, very likely, and when spoken to looks wild; he is about five feet eleven inches high. I purchased him of Henry A. Castle on the 5th of April 1859, and by him bought of Col. John R. White, of St. Louis, Mo. A reasonable reward will be given for his delivery to me, or committed in any jail so that I may get him. JOHN BUHLER. [oct 13-ts]
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: Sugar planter. : (West Baton Rouge [i.e. Port Allen, West Baton Rouge Parish, La.]) 1856-1925

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
